to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: the linux core;tutorials and etc
body:
I highly recommend Linux From Scratch www.linuxfromscratch.org for 
learning how a Linux system is put together.  If you want to go even 
lower than that then search the internet for kernel docs.

Littlefield, Tyler wrote:
> Hello list,
> I've got a question.
> I want to start programming more in depth for linux.
> I want to learn how it does everything, behind the seens, and not just how my commands work etc.
> Is there anything that I might be able to read or look at?
> I want to get down to kernel level, how that all works, etc etc.
> Thanks,
